Legislative History of Laws

Uniform Law:

This section is based on ยง 701 of the Uniform Statutory Trust Entity Act . See Vol. 6B , Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition or ULA Database on Westlaw.

DC CODE ยง 29-1207.01

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: "Constituent statutory trust" means a statutory trust that is party to a merger.
"Governing law" means the law that governs the organization's internal affairs.
A common-law trust that does not have a predominantly donative purpose;
General partnership, including a limited liability partnership;
Limited partnership, including a limited liability limited partnership;
The term "organization" shall include a domestic or foreign organization whether or not organized for profit.

"Organizational documents" means the records that create an organization and determine its internal governance and the relations among the persons that own it, have an interest in it, or are members of it.
"Surviving organization" means an organization into which one or more other organizations are merged, whether the surviving organization preexisted the merger or was created by the merger.
